topic.name: Engineering & Design (Practical Application of Physics)
topic.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Engineering & Design (Practical Application of Physics) in Science & Nature

objectives.objective_text: Identify basic parts on a simple picture plan (door, window, wheel).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a simple problem in daily life and suggest a way to fix it with available materials.
Identify what made something strong or weak in a simple structure.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Recognize that God gives wisdom to create useful things for others.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Recognize God's wisdom in the strength of bones and trees.
Follow a very simple visual instruction to assemble something.
Read a basic labeled diagram or floor plan.
Use symbols and a key in a simple map or schematic.
Build simple bridges with blocks or craft sticks.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Draw or build a basic model to solve a problem (e.g., a blanket fort that stays up).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the steps of the design cycle using a simple project (ask → imagine → plan → create → improve).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Balance simple objects.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Predict structural behavior using basic statics equations.
Draw a labeled picture of something to build.
Thank God for eyes to see and hands to draw.
Explain that clear plans reflect God's orderly creation.
Produce professional-quality CAD or hand-drawn schematics meeting industry conventions.
Defend the ethical responsibility of accurate representation in design documents.
See which shapes hold most weight.
Thank God for real bridges we drive over.
Draw your bridge and label strong parts.
Test span length vs. strength.
Explain how Romans 1:20 is seen in efficient designs.
Build a bridge to hold a given load with limited materials.
Compete in load-to-weight ratio challenges with documentation.
Defend beauty and function as twin goals reflecting God's glory.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Share a creation and say one thing that worked well and one thing to improve.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Sketch a labeled plan before building.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Test a model, record what happened, and suggest one improvement.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Present a final design with evidence of improvement and gratitude to God for creativity.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Build a tower and see how many blocks it holds before falling.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Feel push and pull forces in play.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Marvel that God keeps bridges and trees standing.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why some shapes (triangles) are stronger than others.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Test materials for compression and tension.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the fine-tuning of physical constants that allow stable structures.
Build something and see if it works; try again if it falls.
Say 'thank you, Lord' even when things break because we can learn.
Celebrate small improvements.
Predict what will happen, test, and record results.
Explain that failure is part of learning, just like Peter's walking on water.
Suggest specific changes to make a model stronger or faster.
Practice perseverance in improving a design.
Document iterative improvements with photographs and notes.
Perform formal failure mode analysis (FMEA) on a complex system.
Defend iterative design as reflection of God's patient refinement of His people.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Calculate simple load using non-standard units.
Interpret multi-view orthographic projections and scale drawings.
Connect precise communication in blueprints to the clarity of God's revelation.
Compare beam, arch, and truss bridges using models.
Analyze truss types (Warren, Howe, Pratt) for efficiency.
Calculate forces in truss members.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Compare human inventions to God's perfect designs in creation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze a real-world problem and develop criteria and constraints for a solution.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the dominion mandate (Gen 1:28) to responsible engineering.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Defend engineering as image-bearing sub-creation stewardship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze free-body diagrams and resolve forces.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Calculate center of gravity and moments.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Connect equilibrium to God upholding all things (Col 1:17).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Solve complex statics problems involving trusses and frames.
Analyze failure points using cause-and-effect reasoning.
Connect humility in failure to dependence on God's wisdom (Jas 1:5).
Critique poorly drawn plans and revise for clarity.
Evaluate historical and biblical building plans (tabernacle, temple) for precision.
Connect engineering economy to biblical stewardship.
Evaluate historical bridge failures (Tacoma Narrows) and lessons).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate trade-offs in cost, safety, aesthetics, and ethics.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate material properties (Young's modulus, yield strength) in design choices.
Evaluate historical engineering failures through a providence-and-responsibility lens.
Create a labeled drawing with measurements using a ruler.
Construct accurate technical sketches with dimensions and annotations.
Synthesize exploded views, circuit diagrams, and architectural plans into a single project.
Design, build, and load-test an optimized truss bridge.
Synthesize cost analysis, safety factors, and aesthetic judgment.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Construct prototypes iteratively, documenting changes based on testing.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a complete engineering design portfolio for a community-need project.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Engineering Design Cycle (ask, imagine, plan, create, improve, present)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize biblical wisdom literature (Prov 8; 24:3–4) with modern engineering principles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Statics and Dynamics (Forces in Equilibrium, Load Calculations, Strength of Materials)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize statics, dynamics, and biblical theology of creation order.
Design controlled tests with repeatable procedures.
Synthesize testing data into a technical report with statistical confidence.
